stem:
A 45-year-old man is brought to the emergency department following a road traffic accident. He was having a headache and dizziness on admission. During your night shift, he develops polyuria, and his serum creatinine level was 151 meq/L.

Which of the following test is not indicated?
opt3: Measurement of plasma and urine osmolality
disc:
Acute head trauma can lead to a dysfunction in hypothalamic neurons secreting ADH or posterior pituitary. This results in diabetes insipidus during the first few days following a head injury. They present with hypotonic polyuria.

The assessment begins with urine and plasma osmolality. Hypotonic urine confirms the diagnosis of diabetes insipidus.

However, measuring early morning cortisol level is not indicated here.
tags: Emergency Medicine, Diabetes Insipidus, Head Injury
